activities.name: Vinitaly Wine Festival
activities.description: One of the world's largest wine exhibitions, where thousands of Italian and international producers present their wines. Includes tastings, masterclasses, and special events throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in April. Attracts wine professionals and enthusiasts from around the world. The city becomes very busy during this period.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets well in advance online. Consider booking accommodation months ahead if visiting during the festival.

activities.name: Arena di Verona Museum & Roman Theatre Tour
activities.description: Explore Verona's Roman monuments without the summer crowds. The Arena and Roman Theatre offer fascinating insights into the city's ancient past with more comfortable temperatures for exploring.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers mild temperatures ideal for exploring archaeological sites. Consider visiting in April or May before summer tourist peaks.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase a Verona Card for entry to multiple sites. Morning visits recommended for better lighting and fewer crowds.

activities.name: Giardino Giusti Visit
activities.description: Explore one of Italy's finest Renaissance gardens when its flowers and cypress trees are at their most beautiful. Climb to the belvedere for panoramic views across Verona.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the gardens to life with blooming flowers and vibrant greenery. April and May offer the most colorful displays.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues. Allow at least 1-2 hours for a proper visit.

activities.name: Cycling along the Adige River
activities.description: Rent bicycles and explore Verona and its surroundings via the scenic cycling paths that follow the Adige River, perfect for enjoying the spring weather and blossoms.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers comfortable temperatures and beautiful riverside scenery. The paths are less crowded than summer months.
activities.booking_tips: Bicycle rental shops are located throughout the city center. Some hotels also offer bicycle rentals or free loaner bikes.

activities.name: Spring Opera Season at Teatro Filarmonico
activities.description: Attend the spring opera season at Verona's elegant indoor theater, offering world-class opera productions before the summer Arena season begins.
activities.seasonal_notes: Programming typically runs through April and May. A more intimate alternative to summer Arena performances.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets through the Arena di Verona official website. Dress code is smart casual to formal depending on the event.

activities.name: Arena di Verona Opera Festival
activities.description: Experience world-class opera productions in the spectacular 2,000-year-old Roman amphitheater under the stars, featuring monumental sets, large choruses, and international opera stars.
activities.seasonal_notes: Season runs from June through early September. Performances begin after sunset. Even summer evenings can become cool.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets months in advance for the best seats. Bring a cushion for stone seating in less expensive sections. Arrive early to enjoy the pre-performance atmosphere.

activities.name: Verona Shakespeare Festival
activities.description: Theater festival celebrating Shakespeare, particularly his plays set in Verona. Performances take place in atmospheric locations including the Roman Theatre and historic courtyards.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically runs through July and early August. Open-air performances are weather-dependent.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival website for programs and book in advance. English subtitles or translations are sometimes available.

activities.name: Lake Garda Day Trip
activities.description: Escape the summer heat with a day trip to nearby Lake Garda. Enjoy swimming, sailing, windsurfing, or simply relaxing in picturesque lakeside towns like Bardolino, Lazise, or Sirmione.
activities.seasonal_notes: The lake is most lively in summer, though towns can be crowded. Water activities are ideal in warm summer weather.
activities.booking_tips: Regular buses connect Verona to various Lake Garda towns (30-60 minutes). For more flexibility, consider renting a car or joining an organized tour.

activities.name: Evening Aperitivo on Piazza delle Erbe
activities.description: Join locals and visitors for the Italian tradition of pre-dinner drinks and snacks in Verona's beautiful historic piazza, watching the sunset paint the medieval buildings golden.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings offer the perfect temperature for outdoor dining and drinking. Piazzas are lively until late.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive by 6pm to secure outdoor tables at popular spots. Be aware that tables in prime positions often come with higher prices.

activities.name: Verona Wine Passport Tour
activities.description: Purchase a Verona Wine Passport for self-guided tours of historic wine cellars and tasting rooms throughout the city, sampling local Valpolicella, Soave, and Bardolino wines.
activities.seasonal_notes: Available year-round but summer offers extended evening hours and special events. Air-conditioned wine cellars provide a cool escape from summer heat.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase the passport online or at the tourist office. Includes tastings at multiple venues and can be used over several days.

activities.name: Tocat√¨ International Festival of Street Games
activities.description: Unique festival celebrating traditional games and sports from around the world. The historic center transforms into a playground with demonstrations, workshops, and competitions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in mid-September. The comfortable autumn weather is perfect for outdoor activities and games.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for general attendance. Check the official website for special workshops that might require registration.

activities.name: Valpolicella Wine Harvest Tours
activities.description: Visit the nearby Valpolicella wine region during harvest season to see the production process of famous wines like Amarone and Ripasso, with special harvest events and tastings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Harvest typically takes place from mid-September through October. Some vineyards allow visitors to participate in grape picking.
activities.booking_tips: Book cellar tours and tastings in advance. Several tour companies offer transportation from Verona to multiple wineries.

activities.name: Autumn Cuisine Walking Tour
activities.description: Join a seasonal food tour focusing on autumn specialties of Veronese cuisine, including pumpkin-filled pasta, mushroom risotto, and newly pressed olive oil.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings special seasonal menus to Verona's restaurants featuring local harvest products.
activities.booking_tips: Book food tours at least a few days in advance. Look for tours that include both historic information and food tastings.

activities.name: Verona Minor Hierusalem
activities.description: Special autumn walking itineraries connecting Verona's lesser-known churches and religious sites, with guided tours revealing the city's sacred art and architecture.
activities.seasonal_notes: Special events often coincide with religious festivals in autumn. The cooler weather makes walking tours more comfortable.
activities.booking_tips: Book guided tours through the official website. Some churches are only open during specific hours.

activities.name: San Zeno Antiques Market
activities.description: Browse the atmospheric antiques and collectibles market held in and around Piazza San Zeno on the third weekend of each month, especially charming in the autumn light.
activities.seasonal_notes: The September, October, and November markets often feature unique seasonal items and fewer tourists than summer markets.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed. Arrive early for the best selection. Haggling is expected but should be respectful.

activities.name: Verona Christmas Markets
activities.description: Experience the magic of German-style Christmas markets in Piazza dei Signori and surrounding streets, featuring handcrafted gifts, decorations, and seasonal food and drink.
activities.seasonal_notes: Markets typically run from mid-November through December 24th. Most atmospheric in the evening when lights are on.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit on weekdays to avoid weekend crowds. Try traditional vin brul√© (mulled wine) and local Christmas sweets.

activities.name: International Nativity Scene Exhibition
activities.description: Visit the Arena di Verona for the magnificent annual display of nativity scenes from around the world, housed in the ancient Roman amphitheater.
activities.seasonal_notes: Runs from late November through January. The Arena interior is partially covered during this period.
activities.booking_tips: Standard entrance tickets available at the door or online. Combined tickets with other city attractions offer good value.

activities.name: Winter Opera and Symphony Season
activities.description: Attend opera performances, classical concerts, and ballet at the elegant Teatro Filarmonico during the winter season by the Fondazione Arena di Verona.
activities.seasonal_notes: Season typically runs from December through April, offering a warm cultural experience during colder months.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets through the Arena di Verona Foundation website. Dress code is smart casual to formal depending on the performance.

activities.name: Lessinia Mountain Snow Excursions
activities.description: Take a day trip to the nearby Lessinia mountains for winter activities including snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, and traditional mountain cuisine.
activities.seasonal_notes: Reliable snow typically from December through March. Weekday visits recommended to avoid weekend crowds from Verona.
activities.booking_tips: Equipment rental available on-site. Several tour companies offer transportation from Verona with guides.

activities.name: New Year's Concert in Piazza Bra
activities.description: Join locals and visitors for the traditional New Year's Eve celebration in Piazza Bra, featuring live music, countdown, and midnight fireworks near the Arena.
activities.seasonal_notes: December 31st. Bundle up warmly as temperatures are typically cold. Event sometimes continues with DJ sets after midnight.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for the public celebration. Nearby restaurants offering New Year's dinners require advance reservation, often months ahead.

activities.name: Verona in Love
activities.description: Celebrate Valentine's Day in the city of Romeo and Juliet with this annual festival featuring romantic-themed events, special menus, concerts, and illuminations throughout the historic center.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held during the week of Valentine's Day (February 14th). Special romantic packages offered by many hotels.
activities.booking_tips: Book romantic dinners well in advance. Check the festival program for special concerts or events that may require tickets.
